link.title: Chester Upland School of the Arts - News
Digital Academy - News

form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: This is Superintendent Baughn. Today Governor Wolf has informed us that all K to 12 schools and programs are closed through the 2019 – 2020 academic school year. I understand that this raises many questions and Is disappointing for many of us, however we are all in this together and the paramount focus is on protecting everyone’s health. Our online program will continue to expand and adapt to this extraordinary situation. We will keep you informed as we begin our online programming on Tuesday, April 14th. Our grab-and-go lunch program will also continue Tuesday, April 14th. Please take care and thank you for your support. Again, I will be in touch with you soon to answer the many questions that you and I may have. Thank you. Stay safe. God bless.

Este es el superintendente Baughn. Hoy el gobernador Wolf nos ha informado que todas las escuelas y programas de K a 12 están cerrados durante el año escolar académico 2019-2020. Entiendo que esto plantea muchas preguntas y es decepcionante para muchos de nosotros, sin embargo, estamos todos juntos en esto y el objetivo primordial es proteger la salud de todos. Nuestro programa en línea continuará expandiéndose y adaptándose a esta situación extraordinaria. Los mantendremos informados al comenzar nuestra programación en línea el martes 14 de abril. Nuestro programa de almuerzo para llevar también continuará el martes 14 de abril. Cuídate y gracias por tu apoyo. Nuevamente, me pondré en contacto con usted pronto para responder las muchas preguntas que usted y yo podamos tener. Gracias. Mantenerse a salvo. Dios bendiga.

span.p: This is Superintendent Baughn. Today Governor Wolf has informed us that all K to 12 schools and programs are closed through the 2019 – 2020 academic school year. b.span: CHESTER UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT COVID-19 PARENTS/STUDENT HANDBOOK

span.b: - Please "Click Here" to see the Handbook

strong.span: Tips for your Social and Emotional Wellness: ”SEW” important, especially now!

hr.p: The Coronavirus pandemic has us all focusing on our physical health, causing us to hope we don’t have the illness each time we cough, sniffle, or sneeze. As important, however, is our social and emotional wellness (SEW), especially since our normal daily actions have been placed on hold as we try to follow the advice to stay home and practice social distancing. This means we find ourselves sometimes struggling with the anxiety that can come from being “cooped up…” from sharing space, to having more noise around us all day, to providing activities for children normally in school. Some of us may be feeling very lonely since we can’t get out and mingle with other people. Then there are the economic concerns of experiencing lost or reduced income with bills still to pay and families still to feed. All these realities may lead to STRESS, and we all know the harmful impact of stress on our bodies, minds, and spirits. For this reason, twice a week, the CUSD website will provide tips for taking care of your social and emotional wellness. We need each adult to be physically, socially, and emotionally well so you can be your best for our young people. These will be called “SEW” Tips, and below are the first few:

SEW Tip #6: The Color of Calm – Do you find that some colors stimulate you while others calm you down? If so, you are not alone. Decades ago, most cities stopped using red police cars, aware that red created additional panic and fear in people’s minds, sometimes making a situation appear to be worse than it was. Scientifically, colors have proven to affect our moods. Brighter colors like red, orange and yellow usually energize us and stimulate our brains, while colors like blue, green, and violet are usually more soothing and calming. Pay attention to how color influences how you are feeling. When getting dressed, think about the impact of the color selections you are making on how you want to feel and how others around you might feel. If you are stressed, find a patch of a color that soothes you, and focus on it for a few minutes while taking some deep breaths. Now that it is spring, the colors of the season are bursting forth, bringing us opportunities to appreciate the spectrum of hues in nature available for us to admire while lifting our spirits, thus contributing to our social and emotional wellness.
Keep in mind that while we usually think of touch as physical, right now, any action that helps us lift the spirit and preserve hope counts as touch.
Check out the CUSD website on Tuesdays and Thursdays for more “SEW” tips!

strong.span: All spring sports and any school related activities are cancelled until such time as we re-open.
Todos los deportes de primavera y cualquier actividad relacionada con la escuela se cancelan hasta el momento en que volvamos a abrir.

span.p: Welcome to Chester Upland School District! Home of C-Pride!

If you have comments or questions on our site, you can reach us as via e-mail at website@chesteruplandsd.org. We're also eager for recommendations for new content to share, so if you have great news to share with the CUSD community, let us know at that address.
